meta.s: So close it has no boundaries.
A blinking cursor pulses in the electric darkness like a heart coursing with phosphorous light, burning beneath the derma of black-neon glass.
A PHONE begins to RING, we hear it as though we were making the call.
The cursor continues to throb, relentlessly patient, until --
Data now slashes across the screen, information flashing faster than we read.
We listen to the phone conversation as though we were on a third line.
The man's name is CYPHER.
The woman, TRINITY.
The entire screen fills with racing columns of numbers.
Shimmering like green-electric rivets, they rush at a 10- digit phone number in the top corner.

dialogue.name: CYPHER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: He caught the northbound Howard line.
Purchased six- pack of beer and a box of Captain Crunch.

meta.s: The area code is identified.
The first three numbers suddenly fixed, leaving only seven flowing columns.
We begin MOVING TOWARD the screen, CLOSING IN as each digit is matched, one by one, snapping into place like the wheels of a slot machine.

dialogue.name: CYPHER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Do you know when we're going to make contact?

meta.s: Only two thin digits left.

dialogue.name: CYPHER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Just between you and me, you don't believe it, do you?
You don't believe this guy is the one?

dialogue.name: TRINITY (V.O.)
dialogue.s: I think Morpheus believes he is.

dialogue.name: TRINITY (V.O.)
dialogue.s: I think Morpheus knows things that I don't.

meta.s: The final number pops into place --

dialogue.name: TRINITY (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Are you sure this line is clean?

meta.s: We MOVE STILL CLOSER, the ELECTRIC HUM of the green numbers GROWING INTO an OMINOUS ROAR.

dialogue.name: CYPHER (V.O.)
dialogue.s: See you on the other side.

meta.s: She hangs up as we PASS THROUGH the numbers, entering the netherworld of the computer screen.
Where gradually the sound of a police radio grows around us.
Suddenly, a flashlight cuts open the darkness and we find ourselves in --
The hotel was abandoned after a fire licked its way across the polyester carpeting, destroying several rooms as it spooled soot up the walls and ceiling leaving patterns of permanent shadow.
We FOLLOW four armed POLICE officers using flashlights as they creep down the blackened hall and ready themselves on either side of room 303.
The biggest of them violently kicks in the door -- The other cops pour in behind him, guns thrust before them.
The room is almost devoid of furniture.
There is a fold- up table and chair with a phone, a modern, and a powerbook computer.
The only light in the room is the glow of the computer.
Sitting there, her hands still on the keyboard, is TRINITY; a woman in black leather.

dialogue.name: BIG COP
dialogue.s: Get your hands behind your head!

meta.s: Trinity rises.
She slowly puts her hands behind her head.
A black sedan with tinted windows glides in through the police cruisers.
AGENT SMITH and AGENT BROWN get out of the car.
They wear dark suits and sunglasses even at night.
They are also always hardwired; small Secret Service earphones in one ear, its cord coiling back into their shirt collars.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: Lieutenant, you were given specific orders --

dialogue.name: LIEUTENANT
dialogue.s: You gimme that Juris-my dick-tion and you can cran it up your ass.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: The orders were for your protection.

meta.s: The Lieutenant laughs.

dialogue.name: LIEUTENANT
dialogue.s: I think we can handle one little girl.

meta.s: Agent Smith nods to Agent Brown as they start toward the hotel.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: No, Lieutenant, your men are dead.

meta.s: The Big Cop flicks out his cuffs, the other cops holding a bead.
They've done this a hundred times, they know they've got her, until the Big Cop reaches with the cuff and Trinity moves -- It almost doesn't register, so smooth and fast, inhumanly fast.
The eye blinks and Trinity's palm.
snaps up and the nose explodes, blood erupting.
The cop is dead before he begins to fall.
And Trinity is moving again -- Seizing a wrist, misdirecting a gun, as a startled cop
In blind panic, another airs his gun, the barrel, a fixed black hole -- And FIRES -- Trinity twists out of the way, the bullet missing as she reverses into a roundhouse kick, knocking the gun away.
The cop begins to scream when a jump kick crushes his windpipe, killing the scream as he falls to the ground.
She looks at the four bodies.
Agent Brown enters the hotel, while Agent Smith heads for the alley.
Trinity is on the phone, pacing.
The other end is answered.
She takes a deep breath, centering herself.
She drops the phone.
She bursts out of the room as Agent Brown enters the hall, leading another unit of police.
Trinity races to the opposite end, exiting through a broken window onto the fire escape.
In the alley below, Trinity sees Agent Smith staring at her.
She can only go up.
On the roof, Trinity is running as Agent Brown rises over the parapet, leading the cops in pursuit.
Trinity begins to jump from one roof to the next, her moverents so clean, gliding in and out of each jump, contrasted to the wild jumps of the cops.
Agent Brown, however, has the same unnatural grace.
The METAL SCREAM of an EL TRAIN is heard and Trinity turns to it, racing for the back of the building.
The edge falls away into a wide back alley.
The next building is over 40 feet away, but Trinity's face is perfectly calm, staring at some point beyond the other roof.
The cops slow, realizing they are about to see something ugly as Trinity drives at the edge, launching herself into the air.
From above, the ground seems to flow beneath her as she hangs in flight Then hitting, somersaulting up, still running hard.
They stare, slack-jawed, as Agent Brown duplicates the move exactly, landing, rolling over a shoulder, up onto one knee.
Just below the building are the runbling tracks of riveted steel.
The TRAIN SCREECHES beneath her, a rattling blur of gray metal.
Trinity junps, landing easily.
She looks back just as Agent Brown hurls through the air barely reaching the last car Agent Brown stands, yanking out a gun.
Trinity is running hard as BULLETS WHISTLE past her head.
Ahead she sees her only chance, 50 feet beyond the point where the train has begun to turn, there is -- A window; a yellow glow in the midst of a dark brick building.
Trinity zeroes in on it, running as hard as she can, her speed compounded by the train.
The SCREAM of the STEEL rises as she nears the edge where the train rocks into the turn.
Trinity hurtles into the empty night space, her body leveling into a dive.

She falls, arms covering her head as -- The whole world seems to spin on its axis -- And she crashes with an EXPLOSION of GLASS and WOOD, then falls onto a back stairwell, tumbling, bouncing down stairs bleeding, broken -- But still alive.
Through the smashed window, she glimpses Agent Brown, still on the train, his tie and coat whipping in the wind; stone-faced, he touches his ear piece as the train slides him past the window.
Trinity tries to move.
Everything hurts.
She stands and limps down the rest of the stairs.
Trinity emerges from the shadows of an alley and, at the end of the block, in a pool of white street light, she sees it.
The telephone booth.
Obviously hurt, she starts down the concrete walk, focusing in completely, her pace quickening, as the PHONE begins to RING.
Across the street, a garbage truck suddenly u-turns, its TIRES SCREAMING as it accelerates.
Trinity sees the headlights on the truck arcing at the telephone booth as if taking aim.
Gritting through the pain, she races the truck -- Slamming into the booth, the headlights blindingly bright, bearing down on the box of Plexiglas just as -- She answers the phone.
There is a frozen instant of silence before the hulking mass of dark metal lurches up onto the sidewalk -- Barreling through the booth, bulldozing it into a brick wall, smashing it to Plexiglas pulp.
After a moment, a black loafer steps down from the cab of the garbage truck.
Agent Smith inspects the wreckage.
There is no body.
Trinity is gone.
His jaw sets as he grinds his molars in frustration.
AGENT JONES walks up behind him.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: Did you get anything from the room?

meta.s: The handset of the pay phone lays on the ground, separated in the crash like a severed limb.

We are SUCKED TOWARDS the mouthpiece of the phone, CLOSER and CLOSER, UNTIL the smooth gray plastic spreads out like a horizon and the small HOLES WIDEN until we fall through one -- Swallowed by the darkness that becomes -- A computer screen.
We are on-line, inside a chat room called "The Matrix."
It is an exklusive web-site where hackers hang out.

dialogue.name: SCREEN
dialogue.s: JACKON: I heard Morpheus has been on this board.
SUPERASTIC: Morpheus doesn't even exist and the Matrix is nothing but an advertising gimmick 4 a new game.
TIMAXE: All I want to know is Trinity really a girl?
LODIII: 87% of all women on line are really men.
QUARK: The Matrix is a euphemism for the government.
SUPERASTIC: No, The Matrix is the system controlling our lives.

meta.s: We drift back from the electric conversation entering --
It is a studio apartirent that seems overgrown with technology.
Weed-like cables coil everywhere, duct-taped into thickets that wind up and around the legs of several desks.
Tabletops are filled with cannibalized equipment that lay open like an autopsied corpse.
We turn towards the center of this rat-nest of technology, following the slurping and crunching of cereal.
We pass an open box of Capln Crunch as we find -- NEO, a younger man who knows more about living inside a computer than living outside one.
He finishes his cereal and is about to disconnect when an anonynous message slices onto the screen.

dialogue.name: SCREEN
dialogue.s: Do you want to know what the Matrix is, Neo?

meta.s: Neo is frozen when he reads his name.

dialogue.name: SCREEN
dialogue.s: GIBSON: This is a private board.

meta.s: If you want to know, follow the white rabbit.

dialogue.name: SCREEN
dialogue.s: TIMAXE: Someone is hacking the hackers!

meta.s: Knock, knock, Neo.
A chill runs down his spine and when someone KNOCKS on his door he almost jumps out of his chair.
He looks at the door, then back at the computer but the message is gone.
He shakes his head, not completely sure what happened.
Again, someone knocks.
Cautiously, Neo approaches the door.
Recognizing the voice, he relaxes and opens it.
ANTHONY, who lives down the hall, is standing outside with a group of friends.
He holds up the red notice that accompanies the Denver boot.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: You got the money this time?

meta.s: He holds up two hundred dollars and Neo opens the door.
Anthony's girlfriend, DUJOUR, stops in front of Neo.

dialogue.name: DUJOUR
dialogue.s: You can really get that thing off, right now?

dialogue.name: ANTHONY
dialogue.s: I told you, honey, he may look like just another geek but this here is all we got left standing between Big Brother and the New World Order.

meta.s: A police officer unlocks a yellow metal boot from the wheel of an enormous oldsmobile.
They watch from the window as the cops, silently, robotically, climb into their van.

dialogue.name: ANTHONY
dialogue.s: Don't think about what they're- doing or why.
Computer tells 'em what to do and they do it.

meta.s: FRIEND #l Thc banality of evil.
He slaps the money in Neo's hand.

dialogue.name: DUJOUR
dialogue.s: Why don't you come to the party with us?

meta.s: He looks up at her and suddenly notices on her black leather motorcycle jacket dozens of pins: bands, symbols, slogans, military medals and -- A small white rabbit.
The ROOM TILTS.
An older Chicago apartment; a series of halls connects a chain of small high-ceilinged rooms lined with heavy casements.
Smoke hangs like a veil, blurring the few lights there are.
Dressed predominantly in black, people are everywhere, gathered in cliques around pieces of furniture like jungle cats around a tree.
Neo stands against a wall, alone, sipping from a bottle of beer, feeling completely out of place, he is about to leave when he notices a woman staring at him.
The woman is Trinity.
She walks straight up to him.
In the nearest room, shadow-like figures grind against each other to the pneumatic beat of INDUSTRIAL MUSIC.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: I know a lot about you.
I've been wanting to meet you for some time.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: The Trinity that cracked the I.R.S.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: That was a long time ago.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: I just thought... you were a guy.

meta.s: Neo is a little embarrassed.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Do you want to go sorewhere and talk?

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: It's safe here and I don't have much time.

meta.s: The MUSIC is so loud they must stand very close, talking directly into each other's ear.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: That was you on the board tonight.
That was your note, wasn't it?

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: I had to gamble that you would see and they wouldn't.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: I can't explain everything to you.
I'm sure that it's all going to seem very strange, but I brought you here to warn you, Neo.
You are in a lot of danger.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: Something happened and they found out about you.
Normally, if our target is exposed we let it go.
But this time, we can't do that.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: You came here because you wanted to know the answer to a hacker's question.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: Twelve years ago I met a man, a great man, who said that no one could be told the answer to that question.
That they had to see it, to believe it.

meta.s: Her body is against his; her lips very close to his ear.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: He told me that no one should look for the answer unless they have to because once you see it, everything changes.
Your life and the world you live in will never be the same.
It's as if you wake up one morning and the sky is falling.

meta.s: There is a hypnotic quality to her voice and Neo feels the words like a drug, seeping into him.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: The truth is out there, Neo.
It's looking for you and it will find you, if you want it to.

meta.s: She takes hold of him with her eyes.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: That's all I can tell you right now.

meta.s: She leans close, her lips alrost touching his ear as she whispers.
She turns and he watches her melt into the shifting wall of bodies.
A SOUND RISES steadily, growing out of the music, pressing in on Neo until it is all he can hear as we --
The sound is an ALARM CLOCK, slowly dragging Neo to consciousness.
He strains to read the clock face: 9:15 A.M.
The downtown office of CorTechs, a software development company.
The main offices are along each wall, the windows overlooking downtown Chicago.
RHINEHEART, the ultimate company man, lectures Neo without looking at him, typing at his computer continuously.
Neo stares at two window cleaners on a scaffolding outside, dragging their rubber squeegees down across the surface of the glass.

dialogue.name: RHINEHEART
dialogue.s: You have a problem, Mr. Anderson.
You believe that somehow the rules do not apply to you.

meta.s: He stops, glancing over his glasses at Neo, who turns in time.
His long, bony fingers resume clicking the keyboard.

dialogue.name: RHINEHEART
dialogue.s: This company is one of the top software companies in the world because every single employee understands that they are a part of a whole.
Thus, if an employee has a problem, the company has a problem.

meta.s: He turns again.

dialogue.name: RHINEHEART
dialogue.s: The time has come to make a choice, Mr. Anderson.
Either you choose to be at your desk on time from this day forth, or you choose to find yourself another job.

meta.s: The entire floor looks like a human honeycomb, with a labyrinth of cubicles structured around a core of elevators.
Neo slumps down into his chair.
A TALL EMPLOYEE stands up in the adjacent cubicle, leaning over the partition.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: If I was late again, I'm going to be fired.

meta.s: He smirks.

dialogue.name: TALL EMPLOYEE
dialogue.s: Well, it was nice working with you.

meta.s: Neo glares at him, as he sinks down.
Neo turns and finds a FEDERAL EXPRESS MAN at his cubicle door.
Neo signs the electronic pad and the Fedex guy hands him the softpak.
He opens the bag.
Inside is a CELLULAR PHONE.
It seems the instant it is in his hand, it RINGS.
Unnerved, he flips it open.
Neo's knees give and he falls into his chair.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: I had hoped for this conversation to take place under less adverse conditions, but you can never count on hope, can you, Neo?

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: I've been watching you, Neo, and I want to meet you.
I don't know if you're ready to see what I want to show you, but unfortunately, we have run out of time.
And I'm not sure what they're going to do.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Stand up and see for yourself.

meta.s: Neo starts to stand.
His head slowly peeks up over the partition.
At the elevator, he sees Agent Brown and Agent Jones leading a group of cops.
A female employee turns and points out Neo's cubicle.
Neo ducks.
One cop stays at the elevator, the others follow the agents.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: What the fuck do they want with me?

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: But, if you don't want to find out, you better get out of there.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: I can guide you out, but you have to do exactly what I say.

meta.s: The agents are moving quickly towards the cubicle.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: The cubicle across from you is empty.

meta.s: Neo lunges across the hall, diving into the other cubicle just as the agents turn into his row.
Neo crams himself into a dark corner, clutching the phone tightly to him.
The agents enter Neo's empty cubicle.
A cop is sent to search the bathroom.
Morpheus' voice is a whisper in Neo's ear.
Brown is talking to the tall employee.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: When I tell you, go to the end of the row to the first office on the left, stay.as low as you can.

meta.s: Sweat trickles down his forehead.
Neo rolls out of the cubicle, his eyes popping as he freezes right behind a cop who has just turned around.
Staying crouched, he sneaks away, down the row, SHOOTING across the opening to the first office on the left.
The room is empty.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: How do you know all this?

meta.s: Morpheus laughs quietly.
He opens the window.
The window howls into the room.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: You can use it to get to the roof.

meta.s: Leaning out the window, he sees that the scaffold is several offices away.
Neo looks down; the building's glass wall vertigos into a concrete chasm.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: No way, no way, this is crazy.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Don't be controlled by your fear, Neo.
There are only two ways out of this building.
The other is in their custody.
You take a chance either way.

meta.s: CLICK.
He hangs up.
Neo looks at the door, then back at the scaffold.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Why is this happening to me?

meta.s: He climbs up onto the window ledge.
Hanging onto the frame, he steps onto the small ledge.
The scaffold seems even farther away.
The WIND suddenly BLASTS up the face of the building, knocking Neo off balance.
Recoiling, he clings harder to the frame, and the phone falls out of his hand.
He watches as it is swallowed by the distance beneath him.
He climbs back into the office just as a cop opens the door.
The agents lead a handcuffed Neo out of the revolving doors, forcing his head down as they push him into the dark sedan.
Trinity watches in the rear view mirror of her motorcycle.

scene.sceneheader: INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - CLOSE ON CAMERA MONITOR

meta.s: A wide angle view of a white roon, where Neo is sitting at a table alone.
We MOVE INTO the monitor, ENTERING the room as if the monitor were a window.
At the same moment, the door opens and the agents enter.
Smith sits down across from Neo.
A thick manila envelope slaps down on the table between them.
Neo glances at the name on the file: "Anderson, Thomas

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: As you can see, we've had our eye on you for some time now, Mr. Anderson.

meta.s: He opens the file.
Paper rattle marks the silence as he flips several pages.
Neo cannot tell if he is looking at the file or at him.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: It seems that you have been living two lives.
In one life, you are Thomas A. Anderson, program writer for a respectable software company.
You have a social security number, you pay your taxes and you help your land lady carry out her garbage.

meta.s: The pages continue to turn.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: The other life is lived in computers where you go by the hacker alias Neo, and are guilty of virtually every computer crime we have a law for, including the unauthorized use of the D.M.V.
system for the removal of automobile boots.

meta.s: Neo feels himself sinking into a pit of shit.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: One of these,lives has a future.

meta.s: He closes the file.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: I'm going to be as forthcoming as I can be, Mr. Anderson.
You are here because we need your help.

meta.s: He removes his sunglasses; his eyes are an unnatural ice- blue.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: We know that you have been contacted by a certain individual.
A man who calls himself Morpheus.
Whatever you think you know about this man is irrelevant to the fact that he is wanted for acts of terrorism in more countries than any other man in the world.
He is considered by many authorities to be the most dangerous man alive.

meta.s: He leans closer.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: My colleagues believe that I am wasting my time with you, but I believe you want to do the right thing.
It is obvious that you are an intelligent man, Mr. Anderson, and that you are interested in the future.
That is why I believe you are ready to put your past mistakes behind you and get on with your life.

meta.s: Neo tries to match his stare.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: We are willing to wipe the slate clean, to give you a fresh start and all we are asking in return is your cooperation in bringing a known terrorist to justice.

meta.s: Neo nods to himself.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: That sounds like a real good deal.
But I think I have a better one.
How about I give you the finger --

meta.s: He does.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: And you can cram that file up your Secret Service sphincter.

meta.s: Agent Smith puts his glasses back on.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: The irony of your situation is that you have no choice.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: You can't scare me with this gestapo crap.

meta.s: Agent Smith smiles.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: And tell me, Mr. Anderson, what good is a phone call iy you are unable to speak?

meta.s: The question unnerves Neo and strangely, he begins to feel the muscles in his jaw tighten.
The standing agents snicker, watching Neo's confusion grow into panic.
Neo feels his lips grow soft and sticky as they slowly seal shut, melding into each other until all trace of his mouth is gone.
Wild with fear, he lunges for the door but the agents restrain him holding him in the chair.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: You are going to help us, Mr. Anderson, whether you want to or not.

meta.s: Smith nods and the other two rip open his shirt.
From a case taken out of his suit coat, Smith removes a long, fiber-optic wire tap.
Neo struggles helplessly as Smith dangles the wire over his exposed abdomen.
Horrified, he watches as the electronic device animates, become an organic creature that resembles a hybrid of an insect and a fluke worm.
Thin, whisker-like tendrils reach out and probe into Neo's navel.
He bucks wildly as Smith drops the creature which looks for a moment like an uncut umbilical cord -- Before it begins to burrow its, tail thrashing as it worms its way inside.
Screaming, Neo bolts upright in bed.
He realizes that he is home.
Was it a dream?
His mouth is normal.
His stomach looks fine.
He starts to take a deep, everything-is-okay breath, when -- The PHONE RINGS.
It almost stops his heart.
It CONTINUES RINGING, building pressure in the room, forcing him up out of bed, sucking him in with an almost gravitational force.
He answers it, saying nothing.
MORPHEUS (V.O.).
This line is tapped, so I must be brief.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: They got to you first, but they've underestimated how important you are.
If they knew what I know, you would probably be dead.

meta.s: Neo feels sick.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: I don't know what you are thinking right now but I want you to understand that I will not give up on you until you give up on me.

meta.s: Neo's throat cracks, dry as the Sahara.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Do you still want to meet?

meta.s: CLICK.
He closes his eyes, unsure of what he has done.
An EL TRAIN RAGES against its metal rails.
It is three a.m., and the train carries the usual urban night crawlers.
Neo sits alone, eyes shifting, watching everything nervously.
There is a METAL BANG and TRAIN CLATTER fills the car as the door is opened.
Neo turns and sees a large man enter.
He is wearing sunglasses and a black leather jacket.
His name is APOC and he walks straight at Neo.
Neo stands just as the door at the opposite end opens and two police officers rush in, drawing their guns.
Apoc grabs Neo, muscling him to the nearest exit.
There is no upcoming station.
Apoc yanks the emergency brake and the train buckles against its own speed.
The cops are thrown back.
Neo slams against the metal rail.

The doors open onto nothing and just when Neo regains his balance, Apoc shoves him backwards -- He flies out from the train, arms windrilling as he falls from, the raised tracks -- Hurtling towards a busy city street when, out of nowhere, a truck races under him and -- He crashes into a large dumpster-bed filled with empty boxes.
Still shaking his head, Neo realizes he is not alone.
A man named Cabie is aiming a big gun at him.
Trinity is next to him, talking into a cellular phone.
She hangs up.
She tears off a long strip of black duct-tape and reaches for his face.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: This has to be done for your protection and ours.

meta.s: She seals his eyes shut with the tape.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: You can't understand right now, but if you're not one of us, you're one of them.

meta.s: A featureless black van glides up to a staircase that curls down from the city's surface.
trinity guides the blind Neo down the steps.
The back of the van slaps open, revealing a young, skinny man who looks to be still in his teens, wearing an outfit that is a cross between a surgeon and a telephone repair man.
His name is GIZMO and he smiles lewdly at Trinity, exposing his teeth that are wired with weird-looking braces.
Neo hears the voices around him.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: Are you going to help us or aren't you?

dialogue.name: GIZMO
dialogue.s: Load up the copper-top and let's get the hell outta here.

meta.s: Hacksaw is a huge man in a leather welder's apron.
He shoulders Neo and hauls him into the van.
A moment later the green lights of Lower Wacker curve over the tinted windshield as the van rushes through the underworld.
The chop-shop is filled with electronic gadgets, wired to meters and monitors.
There are shelves lined with medical supplies and rows of hanging tools, knives, cleavers, and stainless steel clamps.
Neo is strapped down to an ambulance cart, listening nervously as Gizmo gets to work.

dialogue.name: GIZMO
dialogue.s: Okay, first we take a little look under the hood.

meta.s: He pulls up the goggles hanging at his neck and they blink to life with tiny halogen lights and lenses irising to varying levels of magnification.

dialogue.name: GIZMO
dialogue.s: You're going to feel a little prick.

meta.s: He inserts acupuncture-like needles into Neo's lower abdomen.
The needles are wired to video monitors.
Hacksaw pilots the fiber-optic lens.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: We can't take you to Morpheus until you're clean.

meta.s: On a monitor, we see the bug nestled in among Neols large intestines.

dialogue.name: GIZMO
dialogue.s: Hit him with 10 ccs of local.

meta.s: Hacksaw loads a hypodermic needle and pumps an anesthetic around Neols navel.
Using a device that looks like a miniature speculum, Gizmo inserts a knuckled dental pick.
Typing into a calculator keypad wired to the pick, he automates the tip.
On the monitor, we watch it telescope out and the end separate into a tiny hooked, metal claw.
The claw snags hold of the bug.
But the bug reacts violently.
Neo screams as it wraps itself around the soft tissue web of intestine.
Neo writhes in pain.
We watch Neo, who can't see what they are talking about.

dialogue.name: GIZMO
dialogue.s: Come on, do it or Hacksaw will.

meta.s: The instant he hears the word, he knows.
The cry is frozen in his mouth as the paddles hit his chest.
Gizmo wrestles with the bug.
Again, the electricity convulses through him as Gizmo yanks the speculum out.
Trinity touches Neo, who is just beginning to breathe.
She eases the tape off his eyes.
He nods.
Hanging from the claw pick is the inanimate metal wire- tap.
The van stops in a deserted alley behind a forgotten hotel.
The doors open and Trinity helps Neo get out.

dialogue.name: GIZMO
dialogue.s: I just hope the man knows what he's doing.

meta.s: She nods then climbs out of the van.
Gizmo ogles the tight leather pants.

dialogue.name: GIZMO
dialogue.s: Goddamn, what I wouldn't give for a copy of that software.

meta.s: Trinity turns around.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: Gizmo, you don't have the hardware to handle this software.

meta.s: He howls with adolescent laughter as the van pulls away.
Trinity turns to Neo.
It is a place of putrefying elegance, a rotting host of urban maggotry.
Trinity leads Neo from the stairwell down the hall of the thirteenth floor.
They stop outside room 1313.
Neo can hear his own heart pounding.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: Let me give one piece of advice.
He knows more than you can possibly imagine.

meta.s: Across the room, a dark figure stares out the tall windows veiled with decaying lace.
He turns and his smile lights up the room.
He wears a long black coat and his eyes are invisible behind circular mirrored glasses.
He strides to Neo and they shake hands.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: As you no doubt have guessed, I am Morpheus.

meta.s: He nods to Trinity.
She bows her head sharply and exits through a door to an adjacent room.
They sit across from one another in cracked, burgundy- leather chairs.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: I imagine, right now, you must be feeling a bit like Alice, tumbling down the rabbit hole?

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: I can see it in your eyes.
You have the look of a man who accepts what he sees because he is expecting to wake up.

meta.s: A smile, razor-thin, curls the corner of his lips.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Ironically, this is not far from the truth.
But I'm getting ahead of myself.
Can you tell me, Neo, why are you here?

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Most hackers would die to meet you.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: But I think we both know there's more to it than that.
Do you believe in fate, Neo?

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Because I don't like the idea that I'm not in control of my life.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: I know exactly what you mean.

meta.s: Again, that smile that could cut glass.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Let me tell you why you are here.
You are here because you have the gift.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: You do not use a computer like a tool.
You use it like it was part of yourself.
What you can do inside a computer is not normal.

meta.s: Neo shrugs.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: How else would you describe what has been happening to you?

meta.s: He leans forward.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: We are trained in this world to accept only what is rational and logical.

meta.s: Neo shakes his head.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: As children, we do not separate the possible from the impossible which is why the younger a mind is the easier it is to free while a mind like yours can be very difficult.

meta.s: Neo locks at his eyes but only sees a reflection of himself.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Do you want to know what it is, Neo?

meta.s: Neo swallows and nods his head.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: It's that feeling you have had all your life.
That feeling that something was wrong with the world.
You don't know what it is but it's there, like a splinter in your mind, driving you mad, driving you to me.

meta.s: The LEATHER CREAKS as he leans back.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: The Matrix is everywhere, it's all around us, here even in this room.
You can see it out your window, or on your television.
You feel it when you go to work, or go to church or pay your taxes.
It is the world that has been pulled over your eyes to blind you from the truth.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: That you are a slave, Neo.
That you, like everyone else, was born into bondage... ... kept inside a prison that you cannot smell, taste, or touch.

meta.s: Outside, the WIND BATTERS a loose PANE of glass.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Unfortunately, no one can be told what the Matrix is.
You have to see it for yourself.

meta.s: In Neo's right hand, Morpheus drops a red pill.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: After this, there is no going back.

meta.s: In his left, a blue pill.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: You take the blue pill and the story ends.
You wake in your bed and you believe whatever you want to believe.

meta.s: The pills in his open hands are reflected in the glasses.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: You take the red pill and you stay in Wonderland and I show you how deep the rabbit-hole goes.

meta.s: Neo feels the smooth skin of the capsules, with the moisture growing in his palms.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Remember that all I am offering is the truth.

meta.s: Neo opens his mouth and swallows the red pill.
The Cheshire smile returns.
He leads Neo into the other room, which is cramped with high-tech equipment, glowing ash-bliie and electric green from the racks of monitors.
Trinity, Apoc and Cypher look up as they enter.
Cypher saddles up to Morpheus, talking in a hushed tone away from, Neo.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: Morpheus, I know what you believe but I think this is a mistake.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Haven't I always told you, Cypher, not to let fear control your life.

meta.s: Neo recognizes the large man from the El train.
He and Trinity are working quickly, hardwiring a complex system of monitors, modules and drives.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: You wrote the Four Horsemen Virus.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Neo, time is always against us.
Will you take a seat there?

meta.s: In the center of the room sits a chair.
Near the chair is an old oval dressing mirror that is cracked.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: I imagine you know sonething about virtual reality.

meta.s: Neo sits and Trinity begins gently fixing white electrode disks to his head, arns, and the back of his neck.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Essentially, it's a hardware system that uses an apparatus; headgear, gloves and whatever to make you feel that you are in a computer program.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: If the virtual reality apparatus, as you called it, was wired to all of your senses and controlled them completely, would you be able to tell the difference between the virtual world and the real world?

meta.s: Neo whispers to Trinity.
She nods, placing a set of headphones over his ears.
They are wired to an old hotel phone.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: The pill you took is part of a trace program.
It's going to make things feel a bit strange.

meta.s: Distantly, through the ear phones, he hears Apoc POUNDING on a KEYBOARD.
Sweat beads his face.
His eyes blink and twitch when he notices the mirror.
Wide-eyed he stares as it begins to heal itself, a webwork of cracks that slowly run together as though the mirror were becoming liquid.
Cypher works with Apoc checking reams of phosphorescent data.
Trinity monitors Neo's electric vital signs.
Neo reaches out to touch the mirror and his fingers disappear beneath the rippling surface.
Quickly, he tries to pull his fingers out but the mirror stretches in long rubbery strands like mirrored-taffy stuck to his fingertips.
The strands thin like rubber cement as he pulls away, until the fragile wisps of mirror thread break.
With the TINKLING of GLASS, shimmering snowflakes of electric-blinking mercury fall, hit the ground, and fade.
He looks at his hand; fingers distended into mirrored icicles that begin to melt rapidly, dripping, running like wax down his fingers, spreading across his palms where he sees his face reflected.
Morpheus takes out a cellular phone and dials a number.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Tank, we're going to need the signal soon.

meta.s: The mirror gel seems to come to life, racing, crawling up his arns like hundreds of insects.
The mirror creeps up his neck as Neo begins to panic, tipping his head as though he were sinking into the mirror, trying to keep his mouth up.
Morpheus is right next to him, with the phone.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: I knew it, I knew it...

meta.s: Streams of mercury run from Neo's nose.
An ALARM, on Trinity's monitor ERUPTS.

His eyes tear with mirror, rolling up and closing as a high-pitched ELECTRIC SCREAM ERUPTS in the headphones -- It is a piercing SHRIEK like a computer calling to another computer -- Neo's body arches in agony and we are pulled like we were pulled into the holes of the phone Sucked into his SCREAM and swallowed by darkness.

scene.sceneheader: INT. POWER PLANT - CLOSE ON MAN'S BODY

meta.s: Floating in a womb-red amnion.
His body spasms, fighting against the thick gelatin.
Metal tubes, surreal versions of hospital tubes, obscure his face.
Other lines like IVs are connected to limbs and cover his genitals.
He is struggling desperately now.
Air bubbles into the Jell-O but does not break the surface.
Pressing up, the surface distends, stretching like a red rubber coccon.
Unable to breathe, he fights wildly to stand, clawing at the thinning elastic shroud -- Until it ruptures, a hole widening around his mouth as he sucks for air.
Tearing himself free, he emerges from the cell.
It is Neo.
He is bald and naked, his body slick with gelatin.
Dizzy, nauseous, he waits for his vision to focus.
He is standing in an oval capsule of clear alloy filled with red gelatin, the surface of which has solidified like curdled milk.
The IVs in his arms are plugged into outlets that appear to be grafted to his flesh.
He feels the weight of another cable and reaches to the back of his head where he finds an enormous coaxial plugged and locked into the base of his skull.
He tries to pull it out but it would be easier to pull off a finger.
To either side he sees other tube-shaped pods filled with red gelatin; beneath the wax-like surface, pale and motionless, he sees other human beings.
Fanning out in a circle, there are more.
All connected to a center core, each capsule like a red, dimly glowing petal attached to a black metal stem.
Above him, level after, level, the stem rises seemingly forever.
He moves to the foot of the capsule and looks out.
The image assaults his mind.
Towers of glowing petals spiral up to incomprehensible heights, disappearing down into a dim murk like an underwater abyss.
His sight is blurred and warped, exaggerating the intensity of the vision.
The sound of the PLANT is like the sound of the ocean heard from inside the belly of Leviathan.
Below Neo, a petal detaches from the stem, bearing away the body of an old man like an automated barge even as a new pod rises up and plugs itself into the empty space.
Inside the new capsule, its surface more translucent and pinkish in color, Neo sees a small baby.
From above, a machine drops directly in front of Neo.
He swallows his scream as it seems to stare at him.
It is almost insect-like in its design; beautiful housings of alloyed metal covering organic-like systems of hard and soft polymers.
A black particle beam washes over Neo, he reacts in pain as the scanner seems to expose the nervous system wired to the coaxial cable at his cerebral cortex.
At the back of the neck, the cable lock spins and opens, disengaging.
The cable pulls itself free, a long clear plastic needle and cerebrum-chip slides from the anterior of Neols skull with an ooze of blood and spinal fluid.
The other connective hoses snap free and snake away as -- The back of the unit opens and a tremendous vacuum, like an airplane door opening, sucks the gelatin and then Neo into a black hole.
The pipe is a waste disposal system and Neo falls, sliding with the clot of gelatin.
Banking through pipe spirals and elbows, flushing up through grease traps clogged with cily clunps of cellulite.
Neo begins to drown when he is suddenly snatched from the flow of waste.
The metallic cable then lifts, pulling him up into the belly of the futuristic flying nachine, hovering inside the sewer main line.
The metal harness opens and drops the half-conscious Neo onto the floor.
Human hands and arms help him up as he finds himself looking straight at Morpheus.
Trinity and Apoc.
And others, dressed in bizarre, high- tech combat gear.
Morpheus smiles.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Welcome to the real world, Neo.

meta.s: Neo passes out.
BLACK.
We have no sense of time.
We hear VOICES whispering.

dialogue.name: MAN (O.S.)
dialogue.s: Do you think Morpheus is right?
Do you think he could be the One?

dialogue.name: NEO'S POV
dialogue.s: We see Trinity's face above us, angelic in the fluorescent glow of a light stick.

meta.s: ANGLE ON NEO
BLACK.

dialogue.name: ANGLE ON NEO
dialogue.s: He opens his eyes again, something tingling through him.
He focuses and sees his body pierced with dozens of acupuncture-like needles wired to a strange device.

dialogue.name: DOZER
dialogue.s: He needs a lot of work.

meta.s: Dozer and Morpheus are operating on Neo.
Fluorescent light sticks burn unnaturally bright.
Morpheus takes his sunglasses off and puts them on Neo.
Neo lays back.
Neo wakes up from a deep sleep, feeling better.
He is wearing a black tank top and shorts.
He begins to examine himself.
There is a futuristic IV plugged into the jack in his forearm.
He pulls it out, staring at the grafted outlet.
He feels his bald head.
His fingers find and explore the large outlet in the base of his skull.
Just as he starts to come unglued, Morpheus opens the door.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: More important than what is when?

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: You believe the year is 1997 when in fact it is much closer to 2197.
I can't say for certain what year it is because we honestly do not know.

meta.s: The wind is knocked from Neo's chest.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: I promised you the truth, Neo, and the truth is that the world you were living in was a lie.

meta.s: Like a sleepwalker, Neo follows Morpheus through the ship.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: This is my ship, the Nebuchadnezzar.

meta.s: They climb a ladder up to the main deck.
Everyone is there.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: You know most of my crew.

meta.s: Trinity smiles and nods.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: The two big guys are Tank and Dozer.

meta.s: The names and faces wash meaninglessly over Neo.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: And this, this is the Core.
This is where we broadcast our pirate signal and hack into the Matrix.

meta.s: It is a swamp of bizarre electronic equipment.
Vines of coaxial hang and snake to and from huge monolithic battery slabs, a black portable satellite dish and banks of little systems and computer monitors.
At the center of the web, there are six ectoskeleton chairs made of a poly-alloy frame and suspension harness.
Near the circle of chairs is the control console and operator's station where the network is monitored.
Neo allows himself to be helped into one of the chairs.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Do you remember when I asked you about an apparatus that could turn a virtual reality into reality?

meta.s: Neo nods.
He touches Neo's head.
Neo feels Morpheus guiding a coaxial line into the jack at the back of his neck.
The cable has the same kind of cerebellum chip we saw inside the plant.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: This will feel a little weird.

meta.s: There are several disturbing NOISES as he works the needle in.
We MOVE IN as Neo's shoulders bunch and his face tightens into a grimace until a loud CLICK fires and his ears pop like when you equalize them underwater.
He relaxes, opening his eyes as we pull back to a feeling of weightlessness inside another place --
Neo is standing in an empty, blank-white space.
Startled, Neo whips around and finds Morpheus now in the room with him.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: We can load anything from clothes, to weapons, to training simulations.

meta.s: Morpheus walks past Neo and when Neo turns he sees the two leather chairs from the hotel set up in front of a large-screen television.
Neo stands at the back of the chair as Morpheus sits.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Right now, we're inside a computer program?

meta.s: Neo's hands run over the cracked leather.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: If you're talking about your senses, what you feel, taste, smell, or see, then all you're talking about are electrical signals interpreted by your brain.

meta.s: He picks up a remote control and clicks ON the TELEVISION.
We drift through the Windy City circa 1996.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: This is the Chicago you know.
Chicago as it was at the end of the twentieth century.
This Chicago exists only as part of a neural-interactive simulation that we call the Matrix.

meta.s: We GLIDE AT the television as he changes the channel.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: You have been living inside Baulliaurd's vision, inside the map, not the territory.
This is Chicago as it exists today.

meta.s: The sky is an endless sea of black and green bile.
The earth, scorched and split like burnt flesh, spreads out beneath us as we ENTER the television.
In the distance, we see the ruins of a future Chicago protruding from the wasteland like the blackened ribs of a long-dead corpse.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: We are, right now, miles below the earth's surface.
The only place humans can survive outside the Matrix is underground.

meta.s: Still MOVING, we TURN and find Neo and Morpheus; the chairs now sitting in the middle of the black desert.
Dizzy, Neo holds onto the chair.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: It started early in the twenty- first century, with the birth of artificial intelligence, a singular consciousness that spawned an entire race of machines.

meta.s: In his sunglasses, we see storm clouds gather.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: At first all they wanted was to be treated as equals, entitled to the same human inalienable rights.
Whatever they were given, it was not enough.

meta.s: In the circular window of the glasses, EXPLOSIONS light up a bloody battle field.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: We don't know who struck first.
But sometime at the end of the twenty-first century the battle was joined.

meta.s: We MOVE INTO his glasses and the war surrounds us.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: The war raged for generations and turned the face of our planet from green and blue to black and red.

meta.s: At last we see the Sentinels; killing machines that are at once terrifying and beautiful.
They have an organic architecture like a microbiotic organism, that is perpetually in motion.
The Sentinel cracks the body armor of a soldier, splitting open the soft, stearing meat inside.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: It scorched and burned the sky.
Without the sun, the machines sought out a new energy source to survive.

meta.s: The Sentinel locks up, as heat lightning of black ink bursts against the sky, spreading into a permanent cloud of stain.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: They discovered a new form of fusion.
All that was required to initiate the reaction was a small electric charge.
Throughout human history we have been dependent on machines to survive.
Fate, it seems, is not without a sense of irony.

meta.s: We return to the power plant that Neo escaped from where we see human beings looking almost blissful in their gelatin cocoons.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: The human body generates more bio- electricity than a 120-volt battery and over 25,000 B.T.U.

meta.s: Outside, spreading all around the power plant, beneath a breathing greenhouse, are the growing fields.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: We are, as an energy source, easily renewable and completely recyclable, the dead liquified and fed intravenously to the living.

meta.s: Huge farm-like reapers are harvesting the crop.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: All they needed to control this new battery was something to occupy our mind.

meta.s: We see inside a clear tubular husk.
Floating in viscous fluid, there is a human fetus; its soft skull already growing around the brain-jack.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: And so they built a prison out of our past, wired it to our brains and turned us into slaves.

meta.s: We PULL BACK to find the image is now on the television and we are again inside the white space of the Construct.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: I didn't say that it would be easy, Neo.
I just said that it would be the truth.

meta.s: The room without walls begins to spin.
His eyes snap open and he thrashes against the chair, trying to rip the cable from the back of his neck.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Get this thing out of me!

meta.s: Dozer holds him while Trinity unlocks it.
Once it's out, he tears away from them, falling as he trips free of the harness.
On his hands and knees, he reels as the world spins.
Sweat pours off him as a pressure builds inside his skull as if his brian had been put into a centrifuge.
Vomiting violently, Neo pitches forward and blacks out.
He blinks, regaining consciousness.
The room is dark.
Neo is stretched out on his bed.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: I can't go back, can I?

meta.s: Morpheus sitting like a shadow on a chair in the far corner.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: But if you could, would you really want to?

meta.s: Neo isn't sure of that answer.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: I feel that I owe you an apology.
There is a rule that we do not free a mind once it reaches a certain age.
They have trouble letting go.. Their mind turns against them.
I broke the rule because I had to.

meta.s: He stares into the darkness, confessing as much to himself as Neo.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: When the Matrix was first built there was a man born inside that had the ability to change what he wanted, to remake the Matrix as he saw fit.
It was this man that freed the first of us and taught us the secret of the war; control the Matrix and you control the future.

meta.s: He pauses.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: When he died, the Oracle at the temple of Zion prophesied his return and envisioned an end to the war and freedom for our people.
That is why there are those of us that have spent our entire lives searching the Matrix, looking for him.

meta.s: Neo can feel his eyes on him.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: I did what I did, because I believe we have been brought here for a reason, Neo.
You are here to serve a purpose, just as I am here to serve mine.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: I told you I don't believe in fate.

meta.s: Morpheus smiles, leaning towards hin.
He stands up.
There is no morning; there is only darkness and then the fluorescent light sticks flicker on.
Neo is awake in his bed, staring up at the lights.
The door opens and TA.NK steps inside.
He offers his hand and Neo shakes it.
He notices that Tank doesn't have any jacks.

dialogue.name: TANK
dialogue.s: Me and my brother Dozer, we are 100 percent pure, old fashioned, home-grown human.
Right here in the real world.

meta.s: Tank smiles.

dialogue.name: TANK
dialogue.s: Goddamn, I got to tell you I'm fairly excited to see what you are capable of.
I mean if Morpheus is right and all.
We're not supposed to talk.about any of that, but if you are, well then this is an exciting time.
We got a lot to do so let's get to it.

meta.s: Neo is plugged in, hanging in one of the suspension chairs.

dialogue.name: TANK
dialogue.s: We're supposed to load all these operations programs first, but this is some major boring shit.
Why don't we start something a little fun?

meta.s: Tank smiles as he plops into his operator's chair.
He begins flipping through a tall carousel loaded with micro discs.
Neo reads the label on the disk.
Tank slides the disk into Neo's supplement drive.
Smiling, Tank punches the "load" code.
His body jumps against the harness as his eyes clamp shut.
The monitors kick wildly as his heart pounds, adrenaline surges, and his brain sizzles.
An instant later his eyes snap open.

scene.sceneheader: INT. MAIN DECK - CLOSE ON COMPUTER MONITOR - LATER

meta.s: as grey pixels slowly fill a small, half-empty box.
It is a meter displaying how much download time is left.
The title bar reads: "Combat Series 10 of 12," file categories flashing beneath it: Savate, Jujitsu, Ken Po, Drunken Boxing... Morpheus walks in.
Tank looks at his watch, rubs his eyes.
Neo's body spasms and relaxes as his eyes open, breath hissing from his lips.
He looks like he just orgasmed.
He locks at Morpheus.
Morpheus sits in the drive chair next to hin.
He nods to Tank.
They are standing in a very sparse japanese-style dojo.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: This is a sparring program, similar to the programmed reality of the Matrix.

meta.s: He assumes a fighting stance.
Neo assumes a similar stance, cautiously circling until he gives a short cry and launches a furious attack.
It is like a Jackie Chan movie at high speed, fists and feet striking from every angle as Neo presses his attack -- But each and every blow is blocked by effortless speed.
While their minds battle in the programmed reality, the two bodies appear quite serene, suspended in the drive chairs.
Tank monitors their life systems noticing that Neo is wildly and chaotically lit up as opposed to the slow and steady rhythm of Morpheus.
Dinner is up.
Everyone is eating bowls of single-cell protein.
It has a cottage cheese consistency.
MOUSE bursts in the room.
All at once they bolt for the door.
Neo's face is knotted, teeth clenched, as he hurls himself at Morpheus.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: But your weakness isn't your technique.

meta.s: Morpheus attacks him and it is like nothing we have seen.
His feet and fists are everywhere taking Neo apart.
For every blow Neo blocks, five more hit their marks until -- Neo falls.
Panting, on his hands and knees, blood spits fror, his mouth speckling the white floor of the Dojo.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Do you think my being faster, stronger has anything to do with my muscles in this place?

meta.s: Neo is frustrated, still unable to catch his breath.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Do you believe that's air you are breathing now?

meta.s: Neo squints at him.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: If you can free your mind, the body will follow.

meta.s: Neo stands, nodding.
Their fists fly with pneumatic speed.
Everyone is gathered behind Tank, watching the fight, like watching a game of Mortal Combat.

dialogue.name: MOUSE
dialogue.s: You ever seen anyone that fast that soon, Tank?

dialogue.name: APOC
dialogue.s: He's got to be the one.

meta.s: The speed of the blows rises like a drum solo that seems impossible to sustain.
Neo's face sheds its mask of calm with a scream.
He wants to beat Morpheus bad.
Finally a single blow catches Morpheus on the side of the head, knocking his glasses off.
There are several gasps.
Morpheus rubs his face.
Neo pants.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Anger is a gift, Neo, but it's a heavy one.

meta.s: Morpheus smiles.
Neo straightens as the dojo DISSOLVES away like a curtain lifting, leaving the two men now standing on a building rooftop in a city skyline.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: You have to learn to let go of that anger.
You must let go of everything.

meta.s: A WIND HOWLS, whipping Morpheus' long coat to the side.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: You must empty yourself to free your mind.

meta.s: Morpheus spins, running hard at the edge of the rooftop.
And jumps.
He sails through the air, his coat billowing out behind him like a cape -- Somersaults once and lands on the rooftop across the street.
Neo looks down at the street twenty floors below, then at Morpheus an impossible fifty feet away.
He takes a deep breath.
He concentrates.
Runs.
They are transfixed.

dialogue.name: MOUSE
dialogue.s: No one's ever made their first jump.

meta.s: Trinity stares at the screen, her fists clenching as she whispers.
Summoning every ounce of strength in his legs, Neo launches himself into the air in a single maniacal shriek -- But comes up drastically short.
His eyes widen as he plummets.
Stories fly by, the ground rushing up at him, but as he hits -- The ground gives way, stretchinp like a trapeze net.
He bounces and flips, slowly coming to a rest, flat on his back.
He laughs, a bit unsure, wiping the wind-blown tears from his face.
Morpheus exits the building and helps him to his feet.
Neo nods quietly.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: If you never know failure, how can you know success?

meta.s: They break up.
But Trinity has left.
Neo's eyes open as Tank eases the plug out.
He tries to move and groans, cradling his ribs.
While Tank helps Morpheus, Neo spits blood into his hand.
Neo stares at the blood.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: If you are killed in the Matrix, you die here?

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: The body cannot live without the mind.

meta.s: Trinity enters from the hall, carrying a tray of food.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: Neo, I saved you some dinner --

meta.s: She sees him passed out on the bed.
She sets the tray down and pulls the blanket over him.
She pauses, her face close to his, then inhales lightly, breathing in the scent of him, before slowly pulling away.
It seems the moment she closes the door, he wakes with a start, unsure of where he is.
After a moment, he gets out of bed.
The ship is quiet and dark.
Everyone is asleep.
The core glows with monitor light.
Cypher is in the operator's chair as Neo cones up behind him.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: Shit, Neo, you scared the bejeezus out of ne.

meta.s: Neo's eyes light up as he steps closer to the screens that seem alive with a constant flow of data.
The monitors are packed with bizarre codes and equations.
He pours Neo a drink from a large plastic jug.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: I'll tell you, I feel for you, man.
Most of us were still young, just punks, when Morpheus jacked us.
But you, you had a real life.

meta.s: Neo takes a sip and it almost kills him.
Cypher pounds on his back.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: It's good for two things: degreasing engines and killing brain cells.

meta.s: Red-faced, Neo finally stops coughing.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: Did he tell you why he did it?

meta.s: Neo nods.

dialogue.name: CYPHER,
dialogue.s: I'll be the didn't tell you that this wasn't the first time he thought he found the One.

meta.s: Neo shakes his head as Cypher fills his cup and laughs.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: Let me give you a piece of advice.
Between you and me, if Morpheus says you can fly, I wouldn't go jumping out any windows to find out if he's right.

meta.s: Cypher raises his drink.
Neo swallows another throat- scorching mouthful.
CHAMBER MUSIC and the ambiance of wealth soak the room as we watch a serrated knife saw through a thick, gorgeous steak.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: That's what he said to me nine years ago.

meta.s: The meat is so perfect, charred on the outside, oozing red juice from the inside, that it could be a dream.
We recognize the grating voice, the insidious laugh.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: I'll tell you what real is.

meta.s: A fork stabs the cube of meat and we FOLLOW it UP TO the face of Cypher.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: Real is just another four-letter word.

meta.s: He laughs, shoving the steak into his mouth.
The restaurant is located on the top floor of a Chicago skyscraper where the view is breathtaking and the menu has no prices.
Sitting across from Cypher is Agent Smith.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: Do we have a deal, Mr. Reagan?

meta.s: Cypher chews the steak loudly, smacking it between his teeth.
Smith watches him shovel another hunk of meat into his mouth.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: You know, I know that this steak doesn't exist.
I know when I put it in my mouth, the Matrix is telling my brain that it is juicy and delicious.
After nine years, do you know what I've realized?

meta.s: Pausing, he examines the meat skewered on his fork.
He pops it in, eyes rolling up, savoring the tender beef melting in his mouth.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: I don't want to remember nothing.
And I want to be rich.

meta.s: Cypher takes a deep drink of wine.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: You get my body back in a power plant, reinsert me into the Matrix and I'll get you what you want.

dialogue.name: CYPHER
dialogue.s: I told you, I don't know them.
But I can give you the man who does.

meta.s: Sweat dapples his lip as Neo snaps out of the construct coma.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Jeez, I was wondering about that.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Why I was bald here but not in the Matrix.

meta.s: He points to one of Neo's monitors.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Main power supply to the core.

meta.s: He follows Tank to the operator's station where he points to a red key-switch.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Uses all remaining power to generate an... E.M.P?

dialogue.name: TANK
dialogue.s: Our best weapon against the machines.
The problem is if someone is still in the Matrix when that thing goes off, they're not coming back.

meta.s: Neo nods as Morpheus comes up behind them.

dialogue.name: TANK
dialogue.s: We just finished the operation programs and he's showing great retention.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: I want everyone alerted to 12-hour stand-by.
Neo, it's time for you to know why you're here.

meta.s: Morpheus walks away.

dialogue.name: TANK
dialogue.s: He's taking you into the Matrix to see her.

meta.s: Neo looks down at the monitor teeming with Matrix data that seems to coalesce, equations giving way to images as a METAL SCREAM RISES BECOMING --
An El train.
The room is empty, heavy curtains covering windows.
It looks as if it hasn't been touched in years.
In the bedroom with the cracked oval mirror an old black PHONE begins to RING.
In the mirror, we first glimpse them and as we keep TURNING, the room fills with equipment and the team.
Morpheus answers the phone.
He hangs up.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Mouse and Cable hold the exit.

meta.s: Neo follows the others down the stairwell that winds around an antique elevator shaft.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Did you have to do this?

meta.s: Trinity looks at him, then looks away.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: Whatever is going to happen is going to happen.

meta.s: They cross the old lobby.
Switch and Apoc stop at the doors.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: We should be back in an hour.

meta.s: Neo squints into the sun that seems unnaturally bright.
He is the only one without sunglasses.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Do you now understand what it means when we say, if you're not one of us, you're one of them?

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: They can commandeer any software hardwired to the mainframe.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: Anyone that is still in a power plant.
That is why we try to be invisible in the Matrix.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: The best hacking is always traceless.

meta.s: Cypher and Trinity move away from them, securing the perimeter.
As Cypher passes a garbage can, he surreptitiously drops something inside.
It is a cellular phone and we watch the blue display as the LINE CONNECTS.
An early 1970s, black Lincoln Continental emerges from a corrugated roll-up garage.
Morpheus and Neo get in.
An enormous man is waiting for them.
A wad of chewing tobacco bulges his cheek.
He spits into a Coke can.

dialogue.name: MOJO
dialogue.s: Morpheus, been a long time coming.

meta.s: Mojo coughs a brown, cankerous laugh, juice speckling his chin and shirt.
He stares at Neo.
He spits and laughs again.

dialogue.name: MOJO
dialogue.s: Guess you are locking for a miracle.

meta.s: The Continental pulls up to a bar in the kind of neighborhood where every corner has a pair of eyes.
A lightless, lower-class bar.
No one enters that is not expected.
The front doors open in a brilliant burst of sunlight as Mojo leads Morpheus and Neo inside.
Neo looks around, his eyes adjusting to the darkness.
Mojo talks to the bartender, then looks over.
They weave their way to the back of the bar, the STICKY FLOOR SNAPPING under their FEET.
A monolith of a man rises from his stool as they walk up.
He moves to the side, opening the heavy iron door behind him.
They descend the basement staircase toward the single bare bulb at the bottom, hanging above the only door.
A high-tech laptop and modem are set up on a stack of milk crates.
Neo waits as Morpheus types in a series of access codes.
After a moment the screen blinks, "Welcome Morpheus."
Morpheus walks back to the same door they entered, but it now leads into --
The walls and floors are polished marble.
Neo follows, his mouth agape.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: It is a part of Zion's mainframe.
It's hidden inside the Matrix so that we can access it.

meta.s: Two PRIESTESSES are waiting in the antechamber.
They take Neo by the arm, leading him down a hall into another room.
Neo enters and finally understands the attention given to his age.
The Potentials are all little children.
The room feels at once like a Buddhist temple and a kindergarten class.
The children's heads are either shaved or thick with dreadlocks.
Some are playing, others meditating or practicing their gift.
Neo watches a little girl levitate wooden alphabet blocks.
A skinny BOY holds a SPOON which sways like a blade of grass as he bends it with his rnind.
Neo crosses to him, sits.
The Boy smiles as Neo picks up a spoon and tries to imitate him.
Despite his best efforts, Neo cannot make it bend.

dialogue.name: SPOON BOY
dialogue.s: Your spoon does not bend because it is just that, a spoon.
Mine bends because there is no spoon, just my mind.

meta.s: Neo watches as it curls into a knot.

dialogue.name: SPOON BOY
dialogue.s: Become the spoon and bend yourself.

meta.s: Neo nods, again holding up his spoon.
He concentrates.
The spoon begins to bend just as the Priestess touches his shoulder.

dialogue.name: PRIESTESS
dialogue.s: The Oracle will see you now.

meta.s: Spoon Boy smiles.
Neo enters nervously.
Beneath his feet is a path of the zodiac leading to marbled stairs that rise to a dais and a three-legged throne.
The throne is empty.
A DISTANT FEMALE VOICE calls to him and he follows it up the stairs.
At the top of the dais, he smells something cooking.
Following the scent, he moves behind the pillars where he finds an open door.
He walks through a vestibule where he sees a fabulous moonstone headdress and velvet robes.
A second door leads into --
It looks like a suburban tract house.
There is a lot of cozy furniture, a dining roon hutch filled with china, shelves and tables crowded with doilies, knick-knacks and ceramic brick-a-brack.
Neo follows the plastic carpet runner to the kitchen.
A WOMAN is huddled beside the oven, peering inside through the cracked door.

dialogue.name: ORACLE
dialogue.s: I got to say I love seeing you non-believers.
All that pomp and circumstances just plain tucker me out.

dialogue.name: ORACLE
dialogue.s: I'd ask you to sit down, but you're not going to anyway.
And don't worry about the vase.

meta.s: He turns to look around and his elbow knocks a VASE from the table.
It BREAKS against the linoleum floor.
She pulls out a tray of chocolate chip cookies and turns.
She is an older woman, wearing big oven mitts, comfortable slacks and a print blouse.
She looks like someone's grandma.

dialogue.name: ORACLE
dialogue.s: I said don't worry about it.
I'll get one of my kids to fix it.

meta.s: She sets the cookie tray on a wooden hot-pad.

dialogue.name: ORACLE
dialogue.s: What's really going to bake your noodle later on is, would you still have broken it if I hadn't said anything.

meta.s: Smiling, she lights a cigarette.

dialogue.name: ORACLE
dialogue.s: I see why she likes you.

meta.s: She winks.

dialogue.name: ORACLE
dialogue.s: You know why Morpheus brought you to see me?

meta.s: She gestures to a wooden plaque, the kind every grandma has, except that the words are in Latin.
She puts her cigarette down.

dialogue.name: ORACLE
dialogue.s: Well, let's have a look at you.

meta.s: She widens his eyes, checks his ears, then feels the glands in his neck.
She nods then looks at his palms.

dialogue.name: ORACLE
dialogue.s: You sure got the gift, but it's tricky.
I'd say the bad news is, you're not the one.
Still got a lot to learn.

dialogue.name: ORACLE
dialogue.s: Same as the bad news, you're not the one.

meta.s: She picks up the tray of cooling cookies.

dialogue.name: ORACLE
dialogue.s: Got a big day ahead of you.

meta.s: He eyes her, then takes a cookie.

dialogue.name: ORACLE
dialogue.s: Make a believer out of you yet.

meta.s: Morpheus rises from a bench as the Priestess escorts Neo out.
When they are alone, Morpheus puts his hand on Neo's shoulder.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: You don't have to tell me anything, Neo, because I already know what she said.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: I brought you so that you could hear it for yourself.

meta.s: Neo finishes his cookie.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: No one will ever ask you because it is a gift from her.
It is for you and you alone.

meta.s: Storm clouds shroud the streets as the sky turns jaundice.
Cypher nervously glances down the surrounding streets.
He notices several unmarked white vans.
He mops the sweat from his forehead, when Trinity sees the black Lincoln.
In the hovercraft, we see the sweat rolling down Cypher's face and neck.
Tank is typing rapidly at the keyboard.

dialogue.name: TANK
dialogue.s: This area never has this much activity.

meta.s: Apoc opens the side door and they enter the hotel.
Mouse's CELLULAR RINGS.
The phone flips shut as he jumps up.
Light filters down the throat of the building through a caged skylight at the top of the open elevator shaft.
Four figures glide up the dark stairs that wind around the antique elevator.
Neo notices a black cat, a yellow-green-eyed shadow that slinks past them and pads quickly down the stairs.
A moment later, Neo sees another black cat that looks and moves identically to the first one.
Those words stop the others dead in their tracks.
The monitors suddenly glitch as though the Matrix had an electronic seizure.
Trinity turns around, her face tight.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: Just had a little deja vu.

dialogue.name: NEO
dialogue.s: A black cat went past us and then I saw another that looked just like it.

meta.s: Trinity looks at Morpheus, who listens quietly to the rasping breath of the old building.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: A deja vu is usually a glitch in the Matrix.
It happens when they change something.

meta.s: She also listens as the staccato BEAT of HELICOPTER BLADES GROW ominously LOUDER.
Tank sees what was changed.
Morpheus looks up the stairs as a helicopter shadow passes over the clouded glass.
Cable goes to the draped windows.

dialogue.name: CABLE
dialogue.s: Did you just feel something weird?

meta.s: The CELLULAR RINGS.
Heavy bolt-cutters snap through the main phone cable.
Mouse answers the phone.
Cable yanks open the curtain.
The windows are bricked up.
The door to the roof explodes open as heavily-armed rnen rush towards room 1313.
Tank watches helplessly.
The door slams open and the police force pours in, dozens of assault rifles surrounding Mouse and Cable who are armed with only handguns.
Morpheus stops as the scream is drowned by the REPORT of MACHINE GUNS filling the building with a terrible fury.
Mouse's body thrashes against its harness as --
BULLETS POUND him against the blood splattered brick window.
Gun smoke thickens the room, Cable blasting and moving until -- The HAMMER CLICKS empty.
He scream as a DOZEN GUNS OPEN FIRE, ripping him apart.
Blood spits from Cable's mouth, his body spasming, then lying perfectly still.
The flat-line ALARM softly cries out from the life MONITORS of the two dead men.
More police cars arrive as cops break open the lobby doors.
Flying downstairs, Morpheus stops, hearing the police swarming below.
He turns and rushes down the hall of the eighth floor.
At the end of it, he finds the bricked-up windows.
The sound of heavy BOOT-STEPS close around them with the mechanical sureness of a vice.

dialogue.name: TRINITY
dialogue.s: They'll be able to track it.

meta.s: Tank answers the call.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Tank, find a structural drawing of this building and find it fast.

meta.s: His fingers pound the keyboard.
Flashlights probe the rotting darkness as the police search every floor.
The diagram windows onto the screen.
Agent Smith pauses, his hand going to his earpiece.
Morpheus is guided by Tank.

dialogue.name: TANK (V.O.)
dialogue.s: Now left and that's it in front of you.

meta.s: He cuts off the phone.
Agent Smith hears the LINE CLICK dead.
Agent Brown hears Smith on his earphone.
Cops flood the eighth floor, rushing everywhere.
Several cops sweep through the room.
It is empty.
As they pass the bathroom, we see a man-sized hole smashed through the plaster and lathe.
They are inside the main plumbing wall, slowly worming their way down the greasy, black stack pipes.
Above them, light fills the hole they made to get inside.
Brown turns to Smith.
The cops search in silence, straining for a clue, when one hears SOMETHING STRANGE near the bathroom.
Cypher has slipped and is wedged between the wall and several thick supply pipes.
The Cop leans in, his ear almost against the thin membrane of plaster separating them.
He can hear WHISPERS, HISSES and a GRUNT when -- The WALL suddenly bulges, SHATTER-CRACKING as the Cop realizes --
Neo pulls Cypher free just as the Cop OPENS FIRE -- BULLETS PUNCHING shafts of light like swords into the box of soot-black space.
The Cop keeps FIRING, his flashlight strapped to his gun barrel, lighting up the wall until -- A BULLET spits out his forehead.
Agent Smith watches the BODY fall with a THUD.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: Are orders that hard to follow?

meta.s: They're almost falling, they're climbing so fast.
Above them, plaster is smashed open as crunbling bits shower down on them, filling the crawlway with dust.
Agent Smith looks into the open wall, at the exposed intestines of the building, and realizes where they are going.
Just below, a RIFLE-BUTT SMASHES open the WALL, light raking across the lathe.
Trinity finds her gun first.
BULLET-HOLES POP out the WALL as she STRAFES the room, sending cops diving for cover.
They continue, Trinity exposed for a roment, when a creeping cop smashes a fist through and grabs a fistful of her hair.
He starts to yank her out when Neo kicks, his boot bursting through plaster and splintering lathe, knocking the Cop out.
They then quickly sink out of sight.
This part of the basement, a dark concrete cavern, was the main mechanical room.
There are four enormous boilers, dinosaur-like technology that once pumped hot water like arteries.
Black and bloody, they squeeze out from the ceiling into the tangled web of pipes.
Their enemies are waiting for them.
Blinding lights cut open the darkness as gas-masked figures FIRE GRENADE LAUNCHERS.
Smoke blossoms from the green-metal canisters.
Morpheus never stops moving.
Searching the floor, he finds what.he needs; the cover of the catch basin.
Cypher watches him pry open the grate, when a gas can bounces near him.
Cypher seems to trip as the cloud envelops him.
Cypher's body begins to shiver uncontrollably.
Morpheus watches Cypher disappear into the smoke then follows the others down the wet-black hole.
They crawl through greasy black water in a three foot diameter pipe that feeds into the sewer main.
Gas-masked apparitions find the open hole.
Cypher is carried out, hand-cuffed, his body still shaking, mucus bubbling out his nose.
As he is led past Agent Smith, it almost seems that both men smile.
Neo punches out the screen and then spills down into the main water trough.
Oily water forms around them as they wade across the man- made underground river, towards the service catwalk.
Neo is about to pull himself out when he sees them coming.
Flashlights and laser sites sweep at them as cops in helmets and heavy armor, looking more nachine than human, fill both ends of the tunnel.
There is a single manhole cover above them.
Morpheus whispers to Trinity.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: You have to get Neo out.

meta.s: She nods.
A font of water erupts as Morpheus leaps for the manhole ladder, his coat flying open like the wings of a manta ray.
Pools of light wash over him as he hauls himself to the surface.
Trinity urges the others to follow her.
Grabbing Neo, they wade quietly away from the chaos.
Morpheus shoots out of the sewer but the police are waiting for him.
The closest cop is armed with a tranquilized gun.
He fires -- But Morpheus' is too fast, using the manhole cover as a shield, blocking the darts, then -- Frisbee-ing it into the cop's armored chest, knocking him off his feet.
The cops lunge at him but every part of his body is a deadly weapon moving with impossible speed.
It seems he might fight his way out when he throws a spinning back fist that is caught by -- Agent Smith.

dialogue.name: MORPHEUS
dialogue.s: You all look the same to me.

dialogue.name: AGENT SMITH
dialogue.s: I've been waiting for this noment.

meta.s: Faster than a snake spits, Morpheus cracks Smith with a jaw-breaking right.
Agent Smith smiles.
Trinity leads the others, fading into the darkness of the tunnel, lit only with shafts of lights streaming through the street drains as we RISE TOWARDS them -- THROUGH a grate INTO the fight.
Smith and Morpheus exchange a furious serious of blows that is witnessed but not believed by the surrounding police.
Agent Smith delivers a punishing kick that staggers Morpheus.
Morpheus smiles.
